com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api

Class PyramidAcceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api.PyramidAcceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PTalkEventListener

    public class PyramidAcceptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements PTalkEventListener
    The Pyramid Acceptor class is the realization of an ICommDevice.
    It uses a RS-232 socket by default.

    Since:
    1.0.0.0

      • valueOfRS232

        public static PyramidAcceptor valueOfRS232(java.lang.String portName)
                                    throws PyramidDeviceException
        Instantiate a new Pyramid Acceptor with an existing port

        Parameters:
        portName - OS string name of the port this is connected to
        Returns:
        New instance of PyramidAcceptor
        Throws:
        PyramidDeviceException - thrown if underlying port cannot be opened.

      • valueOfRS232

        public static PyramidAcceptor valueOfRS232(IConfiguration config,
                                           java.lang.String portName,
                                           int baudRate,
                                           int databits,
                                           int stopbits,
                                           int parity)
                                    throws PyramidDeviceException
        Generate a new PyramidAcceptor with a custom port configuration. This instance of PyramidPort will still use the standard RS-232 packet unless otherwise specified.
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration to use
        portName - OS name of port
        baudRate - integer baud rate
        databits - number of bits per unit of data
        stopbits - bits to indicate end of data
        parity - type of parity
        Returns:
        new instance of PyramidAcceptor
        Throws:
        PyramidDeviceException - thrown if underlying port cannot be opened.

      • valueOfRS232

        public static PyramidAcceptor valueOfRS232()
                                    throws PyramidDeviceException
        Attempt to autodetect the connected slave and use a default RS-232
        configuration.
        Returns:
        a new instance of PyramidAcceptor
        Throws:
        PyramidDeviceException - thrown if underlying port cannot be opened.

      • connect

        public void connect()
        After creating a new ICommDevice, connect() will attempt
        to open the underlying serial port connection and establish
        communications.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        After creating a new ICommDevice, disconnect() will attempt
        to close and flush the underlying serial port

      • getPollRate

        public int getPollRate()
        Return the poll rate for the given device. Depending on the interface this may default to a default value if not set by the client.
        Returns:
        the poll rate in milliseconds

      • setPollRate

        public boolean setPollRate(int rate)
        Set the poll rate for the given device. If the value is illegal, a
        boolean value of false will be returned. A valid poll rate is between
        1 inclusive and 100 inclusive.
        Parameters:
        rate - time in milliseconds at which polling will occur
        Returns:
        boolean true is successful, false otherwise

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        true if the device is connected. Connected means the underlying
        port is open and the courier is running communications. True does not
        imply that all systems are operational.

      • getPortName

        public java.lang.String getPortName()
        Return the OS name of the connected port

        Returns:
        String name of port
        e.g. COM1 or /dev/term
